revised_title: Levellings Across the Isthmus of Panama: Determining the Relative Height of the Pacific and Atlantic Oceans
tldr: The author describes a series of levellings conducted across the Isthmus of Panama to determine the relative height of the Pacific Ocean at Panama and the Atlantic Ocean at the mouth of the River Chagres. The study involved using various instruments and techniques to measure elevation and distance, ultimately finding that high-water mark in the Pacific is 3.55 feet higher than in the Atlantic at Chagres.
